metadata.description: Large S3 ACL test dataset used by the scanner. Programs should ignore this metadata object when parsing buckets.
coverage: Private buckets with only canonical-user grants
Public buckets exposed to AllUsers (READ, WRITE, or both)
AuthenticatedUsers grants (broader than canonical users but narrower than AllUsers)
Mixed grants combining canonical users and public groups
Buckets with empty or missing ACLs to test edge handling
Various regions and grant types (CanonicalUser, AmazonCustomerByEmail, Group)
metadata.notes: This metadata is for human readers and test documentation; scanner logic should only process the 'buckets' array.

buckets._comment: Private bucket: only canonical user grants (no public access).
buckets.Name: private-bucket-1

buckets._comment: Public bucket: AllUsers granted both WRITE and READ (public-read-write).
buckets.Name: public-read-write-bucket

buckets._comment: AuthenticatedUsers grant: broader than canonical users but narrower than AllUsers.
buckets.Name: authenticated-users-bucket

buckets._comment: Mixed grants: canonical users plus an AllUsers grant to test mixed detection.
buckets.Name: mixed-grants-bucket

buckets._comment: Bucket with missing ACL object to test edge handling (scanner should handle empty/missing Grants).
buckets.Name: no-acl-bucket

buckets._comment: Complex grant types: AmazonCustomerByEmail and CanonicalUser with display name.
buckets.Name: complex-details-bucket

buckets._comment: Large grants set: includes AllUsers and AuthenticatedUsers plus canonical users.
buckets.Name: large-grants-bucket

buckets._comment: Bucket with an explicit empty Grants array (no grants).
buckets.Name: empty-grants-bucket

buckets._comment: Public bucket with multiple public permissions and AuthenticatedUsers entry.
buckets.Name: public-multiple-perms-bucket
